00019 int sendall(const int sock, const char *buf, const size_t len)
00020 {
00021         size_t tosend = len;
00022         while (tosend > 0) {
00023                 ssize_t bytes = send(sock, buf, tosend, 0);
00024                 if (bytes <= 0)
00025                         break; // send() was not successful, so stop.
00026                 tosend -= (size_t) bytes;
00027                 buf += bytes;
00028         };
00029 
00030         return tosend == 0 ? 0 : -1;
00031 }

00039 int recvline(const int sock, char *buf, const size_t buflen)
00040 {
00041         int status = 0; // Return status.
00042         size_t bufleft = buflen;
00043 
00044         while (bufleft > 1) {
00045                 // Read one byte from scoket.
00046                 ssize_t bytes = recv(sock, buf, 1, 0);
00047                 if (bytes <= 0) {
00048                         // recv() was not successful, so stop.
00049                         status = -1;
00050                         break;
00051                 } else if (*buf == '\n') {
00052                         // Found end of line, so stop.
00053                         *buf = 0; // Replace end of line with a null terminator.
00054                         status = 0;
00055                         break;
00056                 } else {
00057                         // Keep going.
00058                         bufleft -= 1;
00059                         buf += 1;
00060                 }
00061         }
00062         *buf = 0; // add null terminator in case it's not already there.
00063 
00064         return status;
00065 }

00077 int process_config_line(char *line, struct config_params *params, int *host,int *port,int *user,int *pass)
00078 {
00079         // Ignore comments.
00080         if (line[0] == CONFIG_COMMENT_CHAR || line[0] == ' ' || line[0] == '\t' || line[0] == '\n')
00081                 return 0;
00082         // Extract config parameter name and value.
00083         char name[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00084         char value[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00085         int items = sscanf(line, "%s %s\n", name, value);
00086         // Line wasn't as expected.
00087         if (items != 2)
00088                 return -1;
00089         // Process this line.
00090         if (strcmp(name, "server_host") == 0) {
00091                 if (*host == 1)
00092                         return -1;
00093                 *host = 1;
00094                 strncpy(params->server_host, value, sizeof params->server_host);
00095         } else if (strcmp(name, "server_port") == 0) {
00096                 if (*port == 1)
00097                         return -1;
00098                 *port = 1;
00099                 params->server_port = atoi(value);
00100         } else if (strcmp(name, "username") == 0) {
00101                 if (*user == 1)
00102                         return -1;
00103                 *user = 1;
00104                 strncpy(params->username, value, sizeof params->username);
00105         } else if (strcmp(name, "password") == 0) {
00106                 if (*pass == 1)
00107                         return -1;
00108                 *pass = 1;
00109                 strncpy(params->password, value, sizeof params->password);
00110         } else if (strcmp(name, "table") == 0) {
00111                 int i;
00112                 for (i = 0; i < MAX_TABLES; i++) {
00113                         if ((strcmp(params->table[i], value) == 0))
00114                                 return -1;
00115                 }
00116                 params->index++;
00117                 // save for the table name array 
00118                 strncpy(params->table[params->index],value, MAX_TABLE_LEN);
00119                 // from here on, we save into the new struct
00120                 // over here we have the entire line, we have to save it into our tableInfo
00121 
00122                 // this statement saves each name into the struct, with its index
00123                 strncpy(params->tableInfo[params->index].table_names,value, MAX_TABLE_LEN);
00124 
00125                 
00126 
00127 
00128 
00129 
00130 // ###################################################################   start of weylin's config
00131                 char* split_on_space = NULL;   
00132                 char* split_on_com = NULL;
00133 
00134                 char line2[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00135                 char value[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00136                 char value_type[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];

00138 
00139                 int k = 1;
00140                 int j = 0;
00141 
00142                 int counter = 0;
00143 
00144                 //Code Fragment removes the first two parts of line and stores it in line2
00145                 split_on_space = strtok(line, " ");
00146                 while (split_on_space != NULL)
00147                 {
00148                         if (k != 1 && k != 2)
00149                         {
00150                         //for first case, uses strcpy instead of strcat so it doesnt copy garbage values.
00151                                 if(j == 0)
00152                                 {
00153                                         strcpy(line2, split_on_space);
00154                                         j++;
00155                                 }
00156                                 else strcat(line2, split_on_space);
00157                         }
00158                         k++;
00159                         split_on_space = strtok(NULL, " ");
00160                 }
00161 
00162                 split_on_com = strtok(line2, ",");
00163                 j = 0;
00164 
00165                 //At this point, there is no spaces in the input.
00166                 int incrementer_for_name = 0;
00167                 while (split_on_com != NULL)
00168                 {
00169                         sscanf(split_on_com, "%[^':']%s", value,value_type);
00170                         // at this point, each iteration holds the name
00171                         //printf("%s\n", value);
00172                         strncpy(params->tableInfo[params->index].name_for_column[incrementer_for_name], value, strlen(value));
00173                         if (value_type[0] != ':') return -1;
00174                         if (value_type[1] == '\0') return -1;
00175                         memmove(value_type, value_type+1, strlen(value_type));
00176                         //moves the string one over to get rid of the colon character
00177 
00178                         //Error checking to make sure value_type == to int or char
00179                 if (strncmp(value_type,"char", 4) == 0)
00180                  {
00181 
00182                 int i;
00183                 for(i=3; i<strlen(value_type); i++)
00184                 {
00185                         if(value_type[i]== '[')
00186                                 result = &value_type[i+1];
00187                 }
00188                 if (result == NULL)
00189                 {
00190                         //return error
00191                         return -1;
00192                 }       
00193 
00194                 while (*result != ']' || result == NULL)
00195                 {
00196                         if (isdigit(*result) == 0 )
00197                                 counter++;
00198                         result++;
00199                 }
00200 
00201 
00202                 if ((counter != 0))
00203                 {
00204                         //input isnt valid, return error
00205                         return -1;
00206                 }
00207                 }
00208                 else if ((strcmp(value_type,"int") != 0) && (strcmp(value_type, "+int") != 0) && (strcmp(value_type, "-int")) != 0)
00209                 {
00210                         return -1;
00211                 }
00212 
00213                 //At this point, all input is valid.
00214                 //printf("%s\n", value_type);
00215                 strncpy(params->tableInfo[params->index].type_for_name[incrementer_for_name], value_type, strlen(value_type));
00216                 //Go to next string separated by comma
00217                 split_on_com = strtok(NULL, ",");
00218                 incrementer_for_name++;
00219         }       
00220 // ###################################################################  end of weylin's config  
00221         }
00222         else {
00223                 // Ignore unknown config parameters.
00224         }
00225         return 0;
00226 }

00234 int read_config(const char *config_file, struct config_params *params){
00235         int error_occurred = 0;
00236         //Below variables are used in process_config_line to check for duplicity of parameters
00237         int mulhost = 0;
00238         int mulport = 0;
00239         int muluser = 0;
00240         int j = 0;
00241         int mulpass = 0;
00242         params->index = -1;
00243         int i = 0;
00244         int error_occured = 0;
00245         // Open file for reading.
00246 
00247         FILE *file = fopen(config_file, "r");
00248         if (file == NULL)
00249                 error_occured = 1;
00250         // Process the config file.
00251         while (!error_occurred && !feof(file)) {
00252                 // Read a line from the file.
00253                 char line[MAX_CONFIG_LINE_LEN];
00254                 char *l = fgets(line, sizeof line, file);
00255 
00256                 // Process the line.
00257         if (l == line){
00258                 int temp = process_config_line(line, params, &mulhost, &mulport, &muluser, &mulpass);
00259 
00260         //process_config_line(line, params, &mulhost, &mulport, &muluser, &mulpass);
00261         if (temp == -1)
00262                 error_occurred = 1;
00263         }
00264 
00265         else if (!feof(file))
00266                 error_occurred = 1;
00267 
00268         }
00269         if (error_occurred == 1) return -1;
00270         
00271 return error_occurred ? -1 : 0;
00272 }

00280 void logger(FILE *file, char *message)
00281 {
00282         if (LOGGING==2){
00283         fprintf(file,"%s",message);
00284         fflush(file);
00285         }
00286         else if (LOGGING == 1) {
00287                 printf("%s",message);
00288         }
00289 }

00291 char *generate_encrypted_password(const char *passwd, const char *salt)
00292 {
00293         if(salt != NULL)
00294                 return crypt(passwd, salt);
00295         else
00296                 return crypt(passwd, DEFAULT_CRYPT_SALT);
00297 }
